lines.text: Okay. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughs) I'm going to put that aside.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I spent some of the morning just with a little piece of parchment paper and a pen, just writing out something.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. You guys finish your rest, the servants are eager to send you on your way, should you require anything else. Otherwise, you guys continue your journey?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's head towards the town.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We walk, is that what we do?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We walk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is this walking thing? It's terrible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's also very inconspicuous. I know you're not a fan of inconspicuous, but there's nothing you want to be conspicu-ed by, here.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, I could mist, I could Wind Walk us. Do we want to Wind Walk it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, will that burn something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: My 6th-level spell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just walk, then.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys walking north?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I float on my broom.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Who's leading?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And keep an eye out in front for any sort of problems.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Have fun, doofus!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shh! Yes, I'm leading.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is a lot to leave off, that's a lot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: To not have. That's a big fucking difference.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Would you have kept it if you had known all those other things? Or would you have wanted to use more of it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This is, by the way, the benefits of Identify spells and things like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, shit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, well, if only I'd used my Identify spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But going forward, if you have something you don't know about, you can always go to people with those abilities and be like, could you see what the fuck this does?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do any of our people have Identify?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Negative. It's like a wizard thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I didn't even know people could do that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Allura or Gilmore could probably do that for you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I know about Gilmore.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Such a twinsies.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Aw, so good. All right, so. You guys start heading northward, you're leading then, Vex? Make a survival check. Technically in the forest, since you're moving through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you keep moving north--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! Did you want to look for that lake, or are you good, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, right, remember there was a lake when we were looking for the heart of a nymph?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Doesn't it lead into the Fey world? The plane?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, there's a portal there, right? And isn't one of the vestiges in the Fey?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: In the Fey world?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do we want to do that first, or do we want to deal with--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should probably, but I do want to come back here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yes, of course, it'll be right, next thing we do.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, only if it's close, otherwise I'm good to go back to Westruun. Only if the lake was close, I don't know where it is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Are you in a hurry to talk to Dad?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We don't have to stop there, that's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe later.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, do you need to talk to Dad?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No. We do not need to talk to Dad.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Let's go to Westruun!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Westruun it is!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Sore spot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (something clatters offscreen)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Someone just failed it. Pike!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With disadvantage, Pike.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Disadvantage? Okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm still there, right? No, we took a long rest!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you're fine, you're no longer exhausted.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can I put on my Boots of Levitation?

lines.name: SAM, LIAM, MATT
lines.text: Too late.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I rolled a six.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, she's back!

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Pike is back! What would it be without some clanging?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So as you guys are making your way across the path, keeping as quiet as you can, Pike, you're starting to fall behind a little bit, and in trying to catch up, you get a run on before you start to hear this (hiss) out of the side of the forest, and you see a deep blue scaled-looking lizard entity. You see in the distance a basilisk that's coming over the ridge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh, again.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I wouldn't have let her get that far back, I would've been hanging back there too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, then you're hanging with her and you see this as well, what are you guys doing? It's about, it's about 30, 40 feet off.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How big is it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Should we run?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's the same size as the other ones, they're about five and a half, six feet from nose to back end.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's run. I pick up Pike, I put her on my shoulder, and we run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. First off, Pike, I need you to go ahead and make a constitution saving throw.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aw, because you saw it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glanced over and saw it before you realized.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Oh! I got 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Or no, athletics. This would be your run speed on this one, sorry.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if I'm on the broom, though?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Athletics.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys all manage to maintain a fairly decent pace; these creatures are fairly quick and as they begin to catch up, you begin to use your guidance as a person who knows the forest fairly well to begin ducking in and out of areas, using snowbanks at your disposal. At one point, Grog, you see a partially broken old dying tree that you just go ahead and grab and throw behind you. Make a strength check?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So yeah, we're going to go ahead and take a little trip here to the restroom, we'll see you guys here in a few minutes to continue the next length of this journey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We get to play that shit again, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Why did it get so scary? [break]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And welcome back, everybody. So. Returning from-- Stop dying. Returning from that harrowing endeavor, you continue your trek northward toward Westruun. It is a few days' travel to make your way, a little over two days, I think, from where the Frostweald is, you can stop and pass by the camp at the lake if you wish to, or continue pressing forward, it's up to you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, we should probably stop by and tell them that their problem has been handled.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could stop by later and tell them that both their problems have been handled.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Why can't we stop by now? They're right here, we might as well pop in. We'll forget if we don't do it now. I know us. It'll be three months before we come back, and then we'll be like, by the way--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, we're coming back soon because we're going into the Feywild.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, they know their problem's been handled because we sent all their people back to them.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We pop in, we're like, hey.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think Keyleth wants a reward.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys stop by the Foramere Basin, where you originally saw the encampment of some of the survivors of the Westruun incursion by the Chroma Conclave. As you approach, some of the guards immediately come up, crossbows up, when they notice who it was before previously, they lower their weapons and one of the guards comes forward, approaches you, saying, "Good to see that you've "returned. We've managed to also acquire our recently captured individuals, most at least have "come back safely, it's appreciated. If you wish to talk to Cornelius, well, he should be up and "about. I'll take you." Leads you guys into the camp. As you find your way in, folks around you tend to stop again and watch you quietly as you pass, a few with smiles, and you see a few people wave and say, thank you. And you do see a couple of individuals that you did help escape from the orc encampment, they themselves are still on the mend, a lot of them were fairly brutalized when they were there, but the same child that you found in the tent just runs up and gives a big ol' hug to Vex and holds you for a second, then lets go and runs back off to her mother. You're led back to the tent where Cornelius originally met with you guys, but Cornelius is outside of the tent right now, just in the process of cutting firewood that's going to be used for the firepits later on.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where'd he find the wood? I thought there were no trees around.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You imagine that they don't go to other nearby wooded areas and cut them down?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (glass shatters offscreen)

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh dear.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You think that was an accident.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When you're in 50 episodes, this is the first one.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: This is the first one. It's like that scene in the second Matrix.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Cornelius is there. What little bit of timber they've managed to scavenge or find from local wooded areas, Cornelius sits there, wipes his brow, his sleeves rolled up. "Oh. Hold on just a second." He puts his axe down and walks over, wipes his hands. "Well, you're true to your word. And for "that I'm real appreciative. You did us a real favor and brought back some good people "alive and intact."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Did your brother make it back safely?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Cyrus did and I certainly had a very stern talking-to to that boy. But I--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't go too hard on him, he was being held up by a rope and tortured by a bunch of monsters.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Pretty traumatizing, I would assume.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) "That would be him, wouldn't it? Well, nevertheless, I appreciate it. Looks like "through some talks we might be able to bring most of us into Kymal for the time being. It's the town "to the west of here. It's small, it's cramped, but we figure at least that's better than being out "here in the open. And we have numbers there, so we'll be a little more protected."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's where we'll send word if anything happens in Westruun.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Heading to Westruun yourself, now?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's next on the list.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: If all goes well, you may be able-- no, I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's not make promises.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It may be a while, but we're trying.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Figure if anyone could do it, it'd probably "be you folk. Well. I look forward to hearing from your victorious recovery of our homestead, and "I'll get the first round when we come back to our town."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Farewell, Cornelius.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Stay safe." He turns around and grabs his axe again and starts chopping through the wood once more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was there anything else you wanted to do, Keyleth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, I'm good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to check in with Drez? No, we know what he wants.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck Drez.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That guy's a weasel.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We have his Hunk of Quall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was a gift, I'm pretty sure. It's a loaner, it's on loan for the foreseeable future until we save the world.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Mr. Vina. Mr. Drez Vina.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And by the fact that he called a debt on the initial enchanted ruby that you used on your first endeavor, yeah, you get the feeling that whatever this object is that he gave you, it's probably on loan.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (coughs)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Pike! Are you all right?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Heal her!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys continue forward into Westruun?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To Westruun. And what is our mission?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, what are we, what's our plan here, Grog?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys then, the next morning, can continue your trek northward, and you can probably get to Westruun by the end of day, if you travel quickly and consistently.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What do you think, Grog, what do you want to do? Walk right into town?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. No. I like what Percy said, I think there's worth in being clever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would agree.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would actually like to maybe run some ideas by you. We don't walk into town, but we have the town walk out to us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How do we do that?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, there's many ways we could do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, look, so there are people in there that are innocents, right, we told the farmer we'd get his people back and I really want to see if Wilhand's all right. So listen. How do you feel about sending someone in that would draw out their worst?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think we could draw out their worst very easily. Hmm. How committed are your people to trial by combat?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, it's about all we do.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What can you imagine would be the most exciting show they could possibly hope for?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: A rematch, I would think.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, it wasn't really an official fight, it was more of like a one-sided ass-whooping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But they think you're dead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. We're going to get to that later. I was thinking maybe we could set a fire and send someone running in and say there's a roving band of orcs that are challenging the goliaths, and then when they come out and leave we can move into the town and get all the innocents out. And then if we want, we could set a trap, or an ambush, or we could play some mind games, but I want to try and get the town clear first.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You know, your people might not be the brightest, but they're not going to send everybody out to meet these orcs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No no no no. Just a few.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And probably not Kevdak.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, look, if it's not Kevdak, we get a practice round on those that do come out.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, here's my question: there's got to be hundreds of people still left in Westruun. It could take hours to evacuate a city of that size.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, so you know how last time when we went over there and Horace was just outside the city walls? I'm pretty sure if we wait for a bit, somebody will come out, we take him, we mess him up real good, maybe take his tongue out, chop off his arms, and then send him back in.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Some of that is...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, I'm open to augmenting that plan a little bit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could make you look like an orc or something.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, like I said before, if I go in there--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No no no, just to rough up the guy that we send back in to tell them about the orcs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll hold him while somebody else can rough him up, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How smart are your people?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, pretty smart, they're all like me.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: As smart as you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, scholars the lot.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Grog. If someone kills Kevdak, say hypothetically you, who takes control of the Herd after that?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, my math is a little shoddy, but I think that would be me.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well then, why do we need to evacuate the city if you could theoretically have control over it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we could figure out where Kevdak is and drop in on that point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he's in the mayor's--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah. And handle Kevdak before the rest of the city can descend upon us. It's a gamble, but so is everything we do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but if the city, if the rest of them don't see him defeating Kevdak, then it's worthless. They need to watch it happen.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, how honorable are your people, if you fell Kevdak or whatever the fuck his name is, will the rest stand down?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe, but-- (sighs) So, here it is. My whole life has been wanting to punish or get back at Kevdak. I don't want to do it cheaply, I don't want to do it quickly. I want to do it with my own hands. Now, I'll do it with my family, do it with my buddy Pike, but I want it done right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I've got a thought. It's dangerous, but I have a thought. You literally walk, march right to the city gates and demand a challenge.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a feeling you're going to be the most attractive bait that we can think of.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If we put you right in front there, perhaps we let Pike stay with you, I doubt there's any of them who will not want to watch that. And while they're watching, the rest of us do our best to get everybody as safe as possible.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But what's to keep Grog safe in the meantime?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They won't want to sully that fight, no one will want to sully that fight.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, I can guarantee you, no one will interfere.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if things get bad--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We'll be nearby.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll pull him out.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I like that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't want to abandon Grog to a fight with Kevdak while we're freeing villagers. No offense to them. I want to have Grog's back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I agree with that.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think we won't need to worry about freeing the villagers if we can defeat Kevdak.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we stay hidden?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, wait a minute. Right, so they think I'm dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe I let them think I conquered death.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which you kind of did, Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Maybe we let them think that I'm not the same Grog I was before. Maybe we let them think I've gained abilities.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm pretty sure all those things are actually true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, but I mean like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, make a show of it a bit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. But they don't have to see where those abilities come from.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: All they've got to see is me. There are roofs, right, I mean it's like two- and three-story buildings all in that city.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It just makes me so nervous.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So wait, we stay hidden and you call lightning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah. You guys get all up on the roofs while I'm making a scene in the middle and we pull off the greatest stage show there's ever been.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love a good stage show.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: This is not a bad idea.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's undeniable.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If I do a pelvic thrust, will you do your--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I will grant you cock lightning.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: "I will grant you cock lightning."

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Weirdest production of Grease ever.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How many objects are you attuned to right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Three.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: If he could unattune to one, we can put him in the Hat of Disguise.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't want it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What do you have right now?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have the Gauntlets of Ogre Strength.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have the flaming--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Warhammer?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yup.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: And the belt. What's the other? Oh, and my--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You gained the ability to grow a beard in the afterlife. It's pretty major.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, you have three of those, so you have to get rid of the necklace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Actually, the flaming warhammer's not attuned.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, that's right. That's true, no, you're good.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What does the amulet do?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It gives me plus two to my AC.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Pretty nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's pretty nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And so the object of this would be to stall, to enthrall, to captivate them as long as you can, keep talking to them, not engage in fights for as long as possible while we--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Get in place. I mean, I could try and do it while you're getting the hostages out, or we could just take down the snake's head.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need his Knuckles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kill Kevdak.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but is Kevdak going to engage in a fight with a magical Grog? That's not a fair fight, is it?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a pride issue.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I think he will.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I do know how to get his pride in check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Grog, would you engage in a fight with a magical being who wronged you, if you thought you were better than him?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why, who said something?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And when they discover, and they surely will, that you are not magical and that your friends are aiding you, will that bring you great shame?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No. No, I made a choice. This is my family. My old family left me to die.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Plus, I mean, it's like wearing really cool robes. Right, Scanlan? You know, there's nothing wrong with wanting to look cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I don't know about wanting to look cool, it just comes naturally.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Let's make sure that it doesn't happen, that they won't know.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nice beret there, Scanlan.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: This is going to end with a fight between the two of you, there's no denying that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Anyway, Kevdak's using a gift of the gods.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's right! He's full of shit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: They left him in a very horrible state and I would not like to see that again.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But that was years ago!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We defeated the people who left me in a horrible state, I think we will have no problem defeating the people who left him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We have a gift of the gods and soon we will have many more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because otherwise I would say, I can go in, just sort of looking like you, and draw their attention.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And then what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And then bamf outta there.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: But then what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or run away and draw them with me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How does that save the city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It gets them to follow me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I mean, and either way, I like that because either way, if only the pawns of the group follow him out? That's fewer goliaths we have to worry about. Best-case scenario, Kevdak, Zanror, and the best of the baddies chase him out, we can get the hostages out, and then set the trap for when they come back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's not just the hostages, though, it's a city under siege. I just don't think it's feasible to empty it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Right, but you have to remember it's-- right, yes, pretty much. What you said. It's a city under siege, under siege, it's meta under siege, under siege from the goliaths and then again from the dragons.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They're in a place, though, where if we can get rid of the goliaths, at least they could function with the dragons.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: And if we remove all of the villagers, it'll definitely gain the attention of the dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Will it? I thought they only fly over every few days.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They have wyverns who have been running patrol.

lines.name: TRAVIS, TALIESIN
lines.text: Not over Westruun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But we haven't been hanging out over Westruun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: If there are no wyverns, are you open to the idea of gerbil-ball Scanlan doing a thing?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No, not at all. But that's actually not a bad idea. We're still outside the camp, right? How about this: why don't we hike to the outskirts of Westruun, camp out the rest of the evening, keep an eye out, and just scout for a little bit?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, and if we get close, hopefully we can ask somebody that's nice if they've seen any dragons and how long it's been since.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, we probably want to set up shop for a while and wait for the dragons to come and leave and then strike, so that we've got some time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Very clever.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's brilliant.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We use fake shithead Grog. Sorry. Fake shitheadier Grog to create a scene and run off and draw away some of the goliaths, probably not Kevdak, and then you go in for the main event with a thinned-out Herd.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yep. I like it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I can be on the roofs nearby along with Vex and Percy doing range.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What if we do the same thing that those orcs did? When you go in and cause a distraction and lead them out, we spend the few days that we're waiting for the dragons to build a massive trench, you can use Move Earth, and lead them all out over something and drop a Herd of goliaths.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I can do the Hallucinatory Terrain thing again. It has been a while.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Drop them into a trench, they're stuck in there while he fights Kevdak.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I do love using that spell.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm game.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I like this idea.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It still doesn't solve one question.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What's that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love you, but can you beat Kevdak without magic and friends?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I mean, look, we're going to find out one way or the other. I don't know. But look.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can we aid you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This isn't like the Crucible.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, look, he's wearing weapons given by a god. I don't care if it's a totally fair fight, I just don't want to dispatch him cheaply.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can do this. We've got lightning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's very intelligent of you, Grog.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That means good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Thank you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's rest up and wait for the dragons.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: All right, so we're going to hike to the outskirts of Westruun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys, during this journey, find your way northward. Are you skirting around the west side like you did when you first arrived?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're keeping a good distance, as we get closer, so it lasts, I cast Pass Without a Trace on us.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We have that really nice high grass, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It was like waist-high or so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not like cornstalk high.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There were areas where there was, like during the thick farmland, there are areas where they have high-stalk.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'd like to stay there, I'd like to stay in those areas.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so you'll be pretty much dodging from farmland to farmland, on the outside. I need you all to roll stealth checks, if you could?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten because I cast Pass Without a Trace.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I'm going to use, oh no. Because that won't be enough time.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Come on, Pikey.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's really good. Plus ten.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Plus ten?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, because I cast Pass Without a Trace on us.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're quiet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: He rolled anyway.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right, as you guys leap into the high grass, moving around the outside of Westruun, eyes peeled, as the sun sets and the night kicks in, you try your best to watch for any patrols that are keeping an eye. Make a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. The three of you guys glance over and you do see there is a patrol of three individuals, one of which appears to be goliath in nature, the other two humanoid of some degree. In the distance, it's hard to see this far away. And they're patrolling the same area where you guys came through before. It appears like the patrol has increased, like there's a mildly heightened state of awareness that something bad went down recently. However, you stay far enough away and out of sight, they do not catch visual on you and eventually you get enough distance northward where you feel like they haven't really noticed.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we pass the area that we were at before, where the farmer, Frederick?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you passed that area, yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did we see him?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You did not see him, no.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Was his name Frederick? No, it was with an 'r'.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we go to that place?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Reggie. Reginald, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we sneak there, can Vax sneak there? What was the man's name who we killed?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that you killed?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No no no, the goliath.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Horace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vax, can you go get Horace's head?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, that's a good idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, I can get that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I take that back, that's a great idea.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I don't know why, but I can get that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're heading forward to do that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I rolled a better stealth than him, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a new stealth check. As you guys hold back and you--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, that's so much better! No, it's good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It takes you a few minutes, but you manage to find an area that looks familiar enough where you find your way into the center of one of the crop lanes where the corpse of Horace recently was. Roll a perception check.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 27. You get there and you glance about. But the body's gone.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Body's not there, it's taken. You start following the trail, you see where maybe it was dragged off. Make a survival roll.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Survival roll? Well, I'm going to use Luck, because I slept. Yeah. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do not know where the body was taken, other than north and outward. You glance over and all you see is the original farmhouse where Reginald was living, there's the crops out there, there's the big scarecrow that was in the center. There wasn't a scarecrow before. You look over real close and you see, strung up across a haphazard wooden spike, arms out, is the currently being pecked apart body of Reginald, who apparently suffered the brunt of the discovery of Horace's corpse in the time that has transpired since you last left Westruun.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do I sense anything around?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At the moment? No. The patrol's probably a good ten minutes before it's seeming, because it's headed in the direction where you are but you don't know, probably take ten or 15 minutes before they reach where you are.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to stealth up to the body. Cut him down.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Cut the ropes off, he slumps down.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I shoulder him back to the group.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Make a stealth check with disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys watch as Vax pulls his way up out of the grass, carrying over his shoulder the lifeless body of Reginald.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Let's all talk about repercussions. And I lay him out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, they know we're here now.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do they?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I think they thought it was him.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They did not think the farmer killed Horace.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should've sent him off to the camp.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: They know we're here now because now his body's missing.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Also, I assume they tortured him before they killed him.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know if they're that clever.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you talk to the dead?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: These people were in a shit situation, while I don't blame us entirely for this because of where they live now, we must not do anything we're doing lightly. There are many lives at stake, not just Reginald's. Let's just not flit about, here, let's take this seriously, please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should've left him up there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Should've cut him down tomorrow. One more day up there would have made no difference to him, and it's going to make a difference to us because we have to move tonight now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's a matter of respect, Percy.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Respect him by freeing his daughter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I agree.

lines.name: LAURA, TALIESIN
lines.text: They know we're here.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: They're going to see he's missing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think they already knew we were here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't think they did.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't think they did either.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan, can you make a fake stupid body, can you make a scarecrow?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Not really. Not really.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can any of us?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can fashion something.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, tonight's fine. There's nothing wrong with tonight. I just figure, if we do it, and we should do it, and obviously this is nothing if not a sign that we should've done it sooner.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why don't we just burn the whole field? They won't know if there's a body in there or not.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was our reasoning last time, no, we do this, I think we do this tonight.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: We do this tonight?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I could cast Speak with Dead and we could ask him some questions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We could.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We could ask him up to five questions.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's do it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you guys quietly press down in a small area of grass to give you enough of a space for you to go ahead and perform this ritual. As you lay the body down, you look up to the sky and where some of the cloud cover that is slowly drawing over the area, there's a little gap in the clouds, and as you look up to the now-visible stars, you whisper Sarenrae's name, look down at the body, touch it with your hand, and the still corpse, the chest begins to rise and fall with an unnatural breath for the time being. The eyes begin to twitch and move around. No physical movement beyond that, but the mouth slowly draws open and you hear, while the lips do not move, you hear a voice emanate through like an exhale. "You returned."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Reginald. We're so sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I knew what I was getting into. Do not fret or blame."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We will rescue your daughter.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five questions. Vax. Make it count.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Do they know we're coming?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think we can all ask.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Reginald, how much do your murderers know? About us?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I told them it was me. They should not and could not know your intent to return."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can he describe the one who did it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Go ahead, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi. Sorry. The ones who did you in. Other than large and pale, were there any distinguishing marks or names thrown about?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Half-tattooed face and brow and rags. His jaw, "once broken, pushes to one side. I know not the name."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do I understand that description?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You recall the tattoo, and you recall the moment the jaw was broken.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I was wondering.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This was Zanror.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This was who?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Kevdak's son.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: He broke it. Grog broke it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: What are the things that we face inside the city? What should we fear inside the city?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Fear those that are fueled by rage, skilled with weapons, and those that call the elements "their own. And the dragon does come."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Does come. One more question, can we ask if he's seen the dragon or how long it's been?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Go ahead.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We thank you for your time. If we may, how long has it been since the dragon was last here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Two days."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's coming tomorrow.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Two days, it's coming back. Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That means tomorrow it's coming back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We can wait another day. How many more questions?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is that it, or one more?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we get five.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have one more if we want it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What would you like us to tell your daughter?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Tell her that my life was given so she could live hers. And my memory lives in her eyes." And with that, the head just lolls back a little bit, the jaw hangs open, the last of the breath in the chest (exhales) and the magic fades.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Vax. We have to put it back.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: They don't know we're here. It could be anyone who could've cut him down. Why would they suspect us? I would suspect the village people first.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I would too, and I'm the smartest of them all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Which is actually worse. We need to put something back up. I don't want anyone else to get hurt.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to wait for the dragon to pass, and then he will be buried on his land properly with stone and dirt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yes. I'll take him. Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Thank you. And thank you for bringing him. This was helpful.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: Can we give him a proper burial?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, we're going to put him back up.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: We're going to put him back up, that's what you. Sorry.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Vax, are you taking the corpse back? Stealth check with disadvantage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Disadvantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, carrying him along, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's all right, though, 35.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Jesus Christ.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Rogues. Coming back, as you approach the outside you can see now the patrol has skirted by and you have to wait patiently, but not wait too long because you know you have about a 30-second window before they will come into sight of this farmstead. Using that, you dart forward, take the body, thrust it up, trying to catch-- I want you to go ahead and make a dexterity check to see how fast you can utilize what rope is at your disposal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Just straight dexterity? 17.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 17. lines.text: I can, I remember all of them because I barely kill anybody.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, well, that's fair. I don't think they care who he is.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I think you showing up at the front doors is the best option at this point.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Scanlan, can you do it with an illusion instead of an actual, physical person? Just an illusion?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: My illusions are small in size. I mean, I could just go in as hey, I'm Mr. Scanlan, come chase after me.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is your trick. You pick.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You could be a fucking triceratops again, for all--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are they going to chase after a triceratops, though?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It could make theoretical sense if you're still undead Stonejaw, because, you know, decomposition I'm sure shrinks you a little bit.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: What's something that they would chase after?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Grog.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Anything that moves.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: While you guys figure it out, I'm going to start digging a trench.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll help. I'm going to get some--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No no no, I'm good. I'm good. You stay. I don't want to blow our cover, I'm going to do this all underground.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So outside of the city I'm going to start digging underground and I'm going to start digging a trench.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. So you're using Move Earth?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm moving earth, I'm going to go underground. And it lasts up to two hours.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're going underground to do it?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to go underground and tunnel towards--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, I see, and then create like the trench tunnel underneath, okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And do-- and I want to make it really thin to where there's a nice thin layer of earth, and then I want to make it really deep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, Move Earth is a concentration up to two hours.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh, and I can concentrate on a 40-square-foot for ten minutes. And each ten minutes I can change it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're doing a 40-foot square it could be like 20 feet lower for every 40-foot square you can do, yeah.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah. So real deep.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So we'll say over the two-hour period you could create, for a 40-foot square, like a hundred feet deep, 120 feet deep--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I want to make sure it's wide enough to cover the whole entrance as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because in digging, it'll take you most of that duration to dig up to the gate.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Uh-huh. Underground.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. I'd say, so in order to do this, you have to actually get fairly close before you start digging down there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I rolled a 19.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I have a stealth of 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right, so. You make your way up there, moving through the grass best you can. The guards that are there are partially (yawns) coming to, you begin to slowly manipulate downward into the ground using a relatively untouched patch of high grass for cover, and pushing your way through. Over the next two hours, you manage to dig a ditch, the width of this entrance is about 40 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So from end to end, if you just go straight down from there at 20 feet per section every ten minutes, looking at 240 feet deep if you wanted to go the full, although, actually, having to tunnel underneath would probably take-- we'll say 180 feet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: 180 feet. That'll do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, that's amazing.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I can make the ground thin enough to where it's not going to support weight, yeah?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you give yourself enough of a buffer where yeah, you could, might require a bit of a jolt, make an intelligence check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, jeez Louise. Ooh. 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You feel pretty confident that you've left just enough of a surface that it would support a little bit of weight and maintain its placement. But upon the weight of maybe two humanoid-sized individuals, it would probably crumble beneath.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cool. Cool cool cool. Did I get a little black powder from you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did, I gave you a little bit of black powder.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I put a little black powder in the top of the dirt?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What is a little bit?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Whatever he gave me.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I have a little bit left over. I gave her a third of a barrel worth, like twice this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So I pepper it in the top, where if it gets hit it's going to go boom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to have to deal with it eventually, but I'm fine at the moment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. All right. You pepper it on the earth from underneath. Okay.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it works. Maybe. I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: If it's hit by lightning it should be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: So Grog's father's too big for you, what about the undead severed head of Grog's father?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make an image of that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Floating about in the air with Pike's boots.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my gosh, a floating severed head?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Saying nasty, nasty, nasty things at the Herd.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can do that.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: But he can't move if he's wearing the boots.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He'll be tied to a rope. You can make it move when it's time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you pull him like a balloon?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I can make the head move.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can you be a floating head inside of a hamster ball?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I wouldn't need to be the head, I mean, I can't make my body look like a head.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You can't? I thought you could do anything.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But you can make the illusion of a head talking.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wizard of Oz-style.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can it follow you about?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, he can be on a roof.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would be within 60 feet of me, I think.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Which one?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Minor Illusion, I guess.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Minor Illusion, you could, it's a very minor illusion.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But you could make noise escape from the vicinity of where the head is.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Could I assist with that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Because he has Minor Illusion as well.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If you're close enough to it, it's possible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I could also do-- these goliaths, they don't like wyverns. I could be a wyvern.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The head is so perfect.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You could be a whole wyvern, but you can't be a goliath?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's not a beast, apparently.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Polymorph-- there are higher-level spells that can let you it, but they're a little out of your range.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: A wyvern is a beast?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, we can do the head.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: The head. Be a head! Be a giant, floating, severed head, I like it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can you get me out of there once they come to attack?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I can use the tether and tie you to the broom.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll be the bait.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A wyvern is a dragon, it is not a beast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A wyvern is a dragon, it is not a beast.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I cannot be a wyvern.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can be the bait.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: With the hat? With your hat?

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: How are you going to be the bait?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, how are you going to be the bait?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to have the severed head of your father talking to them.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I can do that too, and I can escape. You can't.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Up to you. All right.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Do it, Scanlan, do it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Come on, Scanlan.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, I can try. Might be shit. How are you going to hide?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I ask this? Let's say we pick this gate where she's digging out this ditch. What is the terrain like on the outside of the wall next to that gate?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Because of the building, or the structure of it for about 30 feet on the outside of the wall it's mainly just hard-packed dirt and earth from patrols for hundreds of years going around the wall, whether it be carts, beasts of burden, or just people walking all around the outskirts of the town of Westruun, it's very heavy-packed and often-walked earth.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Zero cover.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Zero coverage within 30 feet of it, and the grass does thin as it gets close to that. Keyleth had to pick a specific area and get low and even then had to force her way under and use a good, you know, a quarter of her spell time to be able to dig well enough to get past that space.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Past 30 feet from the wall, from the edge of town, what kind of cover is there? Is there any?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not really.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not even the tall grass?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The grass at that point gets about waist- to knee-high, even less so.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is an important thing we need to remember. As we're doing all this, let's just assume that we're us and this'll all go tits-up real quick. We're going to be a fucking long way away from you before we can come to help.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, I'm just kidding, I would never.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: One of us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That would make me feel quite nice.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Sister's good for an escape route.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We should at least find a forward operating base, a place where we can watch this unfold from cover and figure out how far away we are from the first act of our show.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, if everything goes wrong we meet back here at the very least.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I mean, theoretically we'll be stationed throughout, and we'll have our earpieces, correct?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what Vex is for.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm standing nearby on my broom. I'll fly in and pick him up. He can Dimension Door out, though, very quickly.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I also have both of my beast shaping, still, so I can always fly in and evac you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: How far away are we from the entrance now?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys have plotted this, and Keyleth has come back to you through the grass after creating this tunnel, I'd say you're about 150, 200 feet out.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's perfect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And we know Westruun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you know it well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I know how far away from the center of town are we--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wait a minute, are there sewers in Westruun?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We have that option if it comes to it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I hadn't thought of that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's all right. And again, like any good plan, everything will go wrong.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Let's do it!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The grass dies, begins to die away, and become in-- not helpful for stealth about 80, 70-80 feet outside the wall.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can we get a Pass Without a Trace while we all get to our positions?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fuck yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Once you get to about 70 feet from the wall, it's basically just open ground and the large wall that surrounds Westruun.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I could give us a fog cloud.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Can you dig a hole under and we can hang out in a hole with something over top of it so we can bust up out, like shallow ground?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've already burned it. I mean, we can still go underground, I have a tunnel built to a certain point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But we have to be able to get out of it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Let's just keep our distance, let's get them out of the castle and coming out at us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. And then we go in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So. What's the plan? Who's doing what?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I go invisible and start walking into town.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We stay at the very edge, stealthed as fuck.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: You're not going into town, why are you going into town? We dug a giant pit in front of the main entrance.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, everyone be mindful of the pit, I point it out to everyone where the pit is so we can go around it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He is not a very heavy individual. And you were pretty spot-on-- You're fairly certain it can support the weight of a gnome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Sorry. I can Polymorph one person as a stealth kind of deal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are the three guards there, about 20 feet in from the main gate, or the main entranceway, one of which appears to be a female goliath, muscular scar-based torso, very thick, dark, dreaded hair that's pulled tightly to the back of her head and hangs down to the mid-back, and you see two humans that are also as rugged-looking, possibly members of the secondary tribe that they adopted, as was mentioned when you first inquired about the tribe as it currently stands, the Herd. They're all just looking out, bored, one of them is chewing on some dried meat, and they're just keeping an eye out. Scanlan, you've gone invisible and you're approaching the front gate. What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, can you cast Pass Without a Trace on me?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I already did!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, good. I'm just going to walk in, straight into town.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Yeah. Just for the sake of this, go ahead and make a stealth check. With advantage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: With advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, they have very little chance to even notice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So 16 plus--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ten.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Plus two. So 28.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. Given the circumstance that you're invisible and that advantage roll, even the quietness of your footsteps, you manage to literally walk within five feet of them without them noticing. You hear some low mutters, some of it's just like broken words, "Stupid hungry--" And the larger female goliath is like, "Shut up. Eyes peeled. I hate this." They look very unhappy about having to be stuck there at this watch. So you've moved past them, now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, I'm going to go into the-- just the center. We had a scouting party go in and see that-- yes we did, yes we did. It was the center of town, and that's where the key people were around, milling about.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the very center of town is about a 15-minute walk from the outside of town.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can hear everything that happens.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How long does your invisibility last?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: An hour.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: An hour. Okay. You start coasting through the town, you come towards a T-intersection of where the road continues forward and turns to the right, you can see a number of the buildings, just like you saw previously on you guys' journey, some of them are charred and black from fires that have been set. Some of them, you do notice as you pass by, large elements of the buildings have just dissolved, melted down by some sort of chemical reaction. Many buildings still stand. You do see that there are broken barrels and crates in the streets, it looks like a lot of what may have been in storage or being brought around as commerce has been ransacked and raided or relocated. You do see a couple carts that are half-broken or just up on the side, with whatever's on the inside pulled out. You do manage to see a couple of horses that were killed during some altercation that were just left rotting in the middle of the street. There are no people visible on the street. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What time is it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: At this point now? In the two hours for you to do that digging, it's close to 10:30, 11:00 in the morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 13. Okay. You keep walking past, you don't notice anything that catches your attention. You keep moving towards the center of the town. You start moving through the religious district of the middle of Westruun. Make another perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Plus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 19. You glance by what you knew previously in Westruun as the central church of Erathis there. It's a rather, in comparison to the rest of the town, a gaudy temple. But it has been defiled fairly heavily. You can see paint, mud, or some other substance has been smeared across parts of it, portions of the rock have been pushed over and collapsed. You do glance and see a small humanoid peeking through one of the ajar doors that you see, for a second you see a set of eyes, then it sees you and closes the door.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It saw you?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, shit. Fuck, he knows I'm there, I got to keep going. I got to keep going, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're invisible!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah. (laughs) Yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are just barriers and barricades of all sorts of furniture that have been nailed together and this has been made an assault post, where if anyone were to attempt to attack the center of this town, this would be a wonderful defensive position for someone to hole up and wait it out, whether it be against other people or a dragon. It has been built with the best of their ability in that regard. And there are a number of weapons that they've taken from the city that have been bolted in, that have been strapped around, so there's just like jagged edges of halberds and whatever blades they could muster in every direction, therefore if anything wasn't being very careful and running through here, they could be easily shoved into one of these hazards or perhaps even pushed onto it as a means of display. Which you do notice, on a number of these, various heads are currently placed as warning symbols, in varying states of decay. You recognize two of the heads. One of which is--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No no no no no.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sorry. One of them you recognize as the Margrave who once ruled Westruun, whose home Kevdak currently keeps as his own. And the other, let's see if I can recall what this one is. I have it written down here.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I like that this is that deep in your notes, is which heads are on spikes.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Hey, man, got to keep up with this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Appendix A: Heads on Spikes, Various.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughs) Pretty much.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Subappendix: Westruun.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Loran the Bear. Loran the Bear was a mercenary that you guys faced off with the first time that you fought in the brawlers' league. You guys had a playful rivalry? You kept running into each other when looking for various--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's like a best of season one, that's great.

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: The season that didn't air.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But there you see him, or what remains of him, placed on one of these weapons. It looks like anybody who has attempted to rise up or at least make a stink about the current ruling class in Westruun have been put on display in this square in some way, shape, or form.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are there any people? Guards? Goliaths?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see a rather heavy group of well-armored goliaths and other savage-looking humanoid individuals. Mostly human, you see a couple half-orcs, but it's a total of ten of them that are all currently scattered throughout this central area, some of them just sitting down, snacking, a few that are just keeping watch, and a number that are hovering in and out of the door of the main area, giving orders and carrying some small supplies around.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. So I'll just quickly-- are you guys ready?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Do we want to get up on the wall? There's like a wall, right, around the city?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, but I'm in the center of the city.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Also, there's no response.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, he's out of range. Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do you know what the range is on that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The range on those earpieces are roughly two miles.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Two miles.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's out of two miles' range?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well yeah, Westruun's a pretty big town, and it's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's a 15-minute walk, though.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I walk fast.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're a fast walker for a gnome.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He really is a really fast walker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, go ahead.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cast Polymorph on Percy and turn him into a crow.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (eerily good crow noise)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, again with the crows.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Also, I use my beast shape to go into a crow. (crow noise)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: (eerily good crow noise)

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (crow noise)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good enough, that's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And we fly to the walls and perch on opposite sides on the entrance.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Look, your god is here to help us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (crow noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: She sounds like shit.

lines.name: MARISHA, TALIESIN
lines.text: (a panoply of crow noises)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Stop it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's really pleasing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. You guys are perched on the edges of that. Scanlan, what're you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So much. So much.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I feel like this is the first time I've seen you at a loss.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look at those eyes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Don't you want her to read the note?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I go over to where the most people are congregated.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's going to be right at the steps of the Margrave's manor.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I position myself about seven feet away from them.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And I cast Thunderwave.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And with that, (explosion), this burst of thunder comes blasting out centrally from where you are located, Scanlan. The DC on this, with your--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Thunderwave. Oh, is it spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's spell, what's your DC?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Six fail, one succeeds on this save. So you hit them and they're all forced backwards, some of them up onto the stairs, some against the wall. Roll 2d8 points of damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ragdoll physics.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's-- oh, that's, you're right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 11 plus something? No, I guess it's just 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's just 11. All right, and one of them takes five points of damage and (impact sound) looks down at this little gnome that's there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, no, I'm still invisible. It's not a concentration spell.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Invisibility, I'm pretty sure that as soon as you do--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, fuck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Casts a spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Even though it's a concentration spell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, you can cast other instantaneous spells, but as soon as you cast a spell you become visible.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: High-level invisibility, improved invisibility is the one that remains.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'll say, do you have Greater Invisibility?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No. I can cast it at a greater level, but no, I don't have Greater Invisibility.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, at that moment you suddenly become visible.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Roll with it, roll with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi guys. Hi.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But you're Scanlan, you can do this.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The surprise round, they weren't expecting it. Roll initiative right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Oh shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh my god, Scanlan, run.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing, Sam?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is not the plan!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No! No!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Don't say a thing, don't say shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, yeah yeah, it's all you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At the end of this fight, can I have your tie? I mean, you're not going to need it anymore.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Come on, what are you doing?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. I'll Dimension Door into the house where the guy's eyeballs were.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yes! I like it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait, on the, to the house--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The house where I saw the guy who was peeking and saw me, he saw me, I'm going in there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Smart.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How far is the range on Dimension Door?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 500 feet. Was that long ago or recently?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Wait, so. You were peeking, are you referring to the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: The guy who saw me as invisible.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right. Okay, got you. All right, so you're going to that temple. That's probably about 1000 feet from you, you can Dimension Door closer to it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, yes, I will go toward it 500 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You appear to the back end and around the road, just around the corner from where the entrance to that area is, so you're a little ways away. As you appear, catching your breath, you look over your shoulder and you hear in the distance more, a couple yells, and a bell starts going off (ringing) in the center of the town square.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's going great, guys.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do we hear the bell?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys can hear in the very distance a series of bells beginning to go (ringing).

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, sweet Jesus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What're you doing now?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, they haven't caught up to me, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No no, you just moved 500 feet in one second, they have no idea where you went. You just showed up, went "Bye!" and vanished out.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Bell is bad. He's in trouble, we need to go in now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to go again, Dimension Door into the temple.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You've got to be kidding me. Scanlan Shorthalt."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (yelling)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Perfect! Perfect, perfect.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Put that on like a Japanese businessman.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: By the way, this one, under her breath, goes, "Oh I don't like him, he stole from me."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all you can think about?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why am I cheering? He stole from us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They're going to fucking save my life.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, maybe he needed it to save the world.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's all survival. All right, then we'll pick it up from there next week.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jesus. That was a hell of a 50th. Fuck's sake!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why did we even bother to plan?

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA
lines.text: Why do we even bother to plan?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are still on the rails. It is working.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We are still on the rails, it'll be great.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I spent a 6th-level spell building that trench, it had better come in handy.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: It will, it will.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're all going to fall and die in it, it's going to be great.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Scanlan is drunken master.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All righty, guys, we're going to go ahead and take a few minutes here to hunker down and prepare for the savage unwrapping of many presents that you, the community of Critical Role, have put in our direction. All of us so eternally undeserving, but so incredibly appreciative of all that you guys do, both to help with the charities that we support and spend your time being so awesome and creative and we're going to go ahead and--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Matt, though, but what are we going to do with the minutes while we're not on camera right now? How do we fill the airtime?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We'll, I'm sure, have a few videos to show that may also include our new intro.

lines.name: TALIESIN, MARISHA, LAURA
lines.text: Again! Again!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: [end of transcript]
